intro: Calceolaria caffra, commonly known as the Cape slipper orchid, is a striking South African plant characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to the coastal regions of South Africa. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to white, are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calceolaria caffra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
